column5: Last Sunday, we got our deer late in the afternoon and came back out of the bush in the dark   Remember him    Well this weekend, it was the opposite   We came back out of the bush bright and early   Got another spike Saturday morning   Guestimated @ 125Lbs field dressed   Our friend shot it at 7:20am to finish the season  made sure, this time to snap a few pics for your viewing pleasure  Last night, the tenderloins made an appearance in the pan and again, had a hunter's dream meal along side of heart, kidneys and liver cut into steaks  Without getting into the details.... I'll let the pictures do the talking  Enjoy!!!  Our freezer guest... a twin   slightly heavier!    Our friend and his wife    His wife.... an avid hunter by the way    My brother    Me    My brother and I    All in all, was a great successful season for us Looking forward to hard water season now Tight lines Leechman
Nice going Jacques Eat well my friend
Meats meat. Good job my friend.   Nice harvesting.
Thanks Paul!!! I sure will    Every Friday for supper from then on, will be deer meal at my house   until I ran out   Thanks Brian!!!
There's meat for Christmas again! BTW, did it take you two days to take those pictures, Jacques?
Congrats on a successful season buddy!  It will be great over the winter!    Darren

I knew you were very dangerous for the walleye in the area but evidently the dear has to hide from you too ha ha ha...thanks for the photos....one of those days I am going to become a hunter myself  Cheers, Ice Fisherman

Thanks Roy!!! Yep   I was only able to go weekends this year and opener was not an option     This was 4 solid days of hunting for me and our group and I'm really pleased with the results   Thanks Darren!!!  You bet   Thanks Emil!!!  LOL They can hide but not for long LOL  Best therapy in the world... sitting by yourself in the bush and wait for them to stroll by

Is the season over there?It starts here on October 1st and continues in one form or another until March 31st.We need more deer dead here. Here is a link to the regs,I live in Loudoun county.http://www.dgif.virginia.gov/hunting/regulations/deer.asp
Yes it is, riffle and bow... Looks like the deer population is out of control in your area    If you hunt... good luck harvesting

I do hunt here and the deer population is out of control here.I'm surprised that y'all have such and early and short season but I guess that is how they manage the herd.Congradulations of your score,gonna get some fine venison from that. Joe

Thanks Joe!!!  The riffle season is short over here (first 2 weeks of November) If I was going bow hunt, I would have from mid September to mid October.  We also have doe draw but I haven't had the luxury of wining in a few years    but I keep applying  Thanks again Joe and wish you the best of luck in your hunt Jacques
Awesome Jacques !!! looks like a great time  Peps
Nice going Jacques! Always good when you can share your passion with friends and family.  Thanks for sharing.
Good Job! He looks tasty! Can't wait for mine to get back from the butcher.
Thanks Peps!!! It sure was   Thanks Tony!!!   Thanks Luc!!!  Both are at the butcher and I too can't wait for the meat to be ready for pickup
